circuits module

Circuits module

  • Provides a class of constructing a circuit on either 1 or two qubits

  • Both single qubit and two qubit files can be added to the circuit

  • Can perform measurements in the computational basis

Dependencies:

  • numpy

  • gates

  • states

  • copy

class circuits.Circuits(N_wires=1, state_init=<states.Zero object>)

Bases: object

The Circuits object is a representation of a quantum circuit that stores the sequential order of unitary operations

N_wires

The number of qubits/wires of the circuit

Type:

int

State_init

The initial state of the circuit

Type:

States

add_single_qubit_gate(gate: Gate, target_wire: int = 0)

Function to add a single qubit gate to the circuit at a given wire. Creates a tuple of the gate and the target wire and appends it to the gates list.

Parameters:

  • gate (Gates) – The gate to be added to the circuit.

  • target_wire (int) – The wire the gate is to be applied to.

add_two_qubit_gate(gate: Gate, target_wires: list = [0, 1])

Function to add a two qubit gate to the circuit at a given wire. Creates a tuple of the gate and the target wires and appends it to the gates list.

Parameters:

  • gate (Gates) – The gate to be added to the circuit.

  • target_wire (int) – The wire the gate is to be applied to.

get_gates()

Returns the current list of gates in the circuit

Returns:

a list of tuples ([i], gate), where [i] is a list indicating which wire the circuit is on and gate is the Gate object

Return type:

list

get_state_init()

Returns the initial quantum state of the circuit as an array

Returns:

The state as a numpy array

Return type:

array

measure_qubits()
run_circuit()

Applies the circuit to the initial state

Returns:

Final state after running the circuit

Return type:

State
